title: WCAS FRENCH 125-3-20 Intensive Intermediate French
class_attributes:
Attendance at 1st class mandatory

Prerequisites apply, see description

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: French 125-3 is the third quarter of the three-quarter Intensive Intermediate French course for students who have completed French 125-2 or have been placed in that course by the French department. The primary goal of this course is to strengthen oral and written communication skills by immersing students in authentic cultural contexts and language. A review of essential grammar will reinforce linguistic foundations. Class meets three times a week and will be conducted in French. The last quarter of the sequence (125-3) allows you/sudents to satisfy the WCAS language requirement (grade of C- or higher).

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: French 125-2 or department placement -No PN allowed -Attendance at the first class is mandatory

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Class participation, homework & quizzes, four compositions, four lesson tests and end-of-quarter oral test.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Réseau: Communication, Intégration, Intersections. Jean Marie Schultz, Marie-Paule Tranvouez, Second edition, Pearson. -Online Student Activities Manual for Réseau: Communication, Intégration, Intersections. Pearson.

subject: FRENCH
